chargeHist.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine(>10-50g)
Drive or Operate Vehicle without Owner's Consent (2nd+ offense)

result.execSummary:
The defendant James E. Pettis Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**49 days credit if probation revoked.**  *Case 20CT226 dismissed and read in.*

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E. Pettis Jr.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.
*See Plea Hearing docket.*

(3:27 PM cases 20CM436, 20CT226, 21CF125, 21CF765, 21CF791, 22CF188 called.) Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James E. Pettis Jr. in court, in custody. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for James E. Pettis Jr.
Defendant waives reading of Information in case 22CF188 and enters Not Guilty pleas.
Attorney Linzmeier advises defendant is withdrawing motion and cases are ready to proceed to plea and sentencing.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 20CM436 Amended Count 1: Domestic Disorderly Conduct, Amended Count 3: Obstructing an Officer, 21CF125 Amended Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine as Party to a Crime, 21CF765 Count 3: Operate Motor Vehicle While Revoked, 21CF791 Amended Count 1: Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>3-10g) as a Second or Subsequent Offense, Amended Count 3: Felony Bail Jumping, 22CF188 Amended Count 1: Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>10-50g) and Amended Count 4: Felony Bail Jumping.
Defendant acknowledges prior offense for second and subsequent enhancer.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 20CM436 Amended Count 1, Amended Count 3, 21CF125 Amended Count 1, 21CF765 Count 3, 21CF791 Amended Count 1, Amended Count 3, 22CF188 Amended Count 1 and Amended Count 4.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 54 months on 21CF791 Count 1 and 22CF188 Count 1 with the following conditions:
120 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on both 21CF791 Count 1 and 22CF188 Count 1. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with L.N., T.C. or the residence at 719 Eddy Street, Eau Claire, WI. No contact with any known drug dealer/user, except in a therapeutic setting. Restitution plus 5% and 10% surcharges to be determined within 60 days on 21CF791 Count 1. Forfeit $1.00 to the WCDTF in 21CF791 Count 1. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 2 days credit in 21CF791 and 49 days credit in 22CF188 if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including cases 20CT226, 20TR5130, 20TR5131 are dismissed and read in. 

Court orders sentence as follows for 20CM436 Count 1 and 3, 21CF125 Count 1, 21CF765 Count 3, 21CF791 Count 3 and 22CF188 Count 4:
Defendant to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs to include a domestic abuse surcharge and bench warrant fee in 20CM436.

Attorney Linzmeier motions for the defendant's seized cell phones to be returned. State advises will check with the jail. Court orders once the appellate time has passed the cell phones may be returned.
Plea Offer
Elements of the Offense: Felony Bail Jumping
Elements of the Offense: Possession with Intent to Deliver

(Case called at 11:32 AM- by Zoom) Defendant James E. Pettis Jr. appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Alicia Linzmeier for James E. Pettis Jr. appeared in court, District Attorney Peter J. Rindal for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Defense's Motion to modify bond. Defense makes argument. State objects to any modification of bond and makes argument. Defendant indicates he could pay a much smaller cash bond- requests CTC as a condition to a signature bond. State continues argument objecting to motion- recites failures to appear. 
Court denies Defense's Motion to deny bond modification. Arraignment already scheduled with Branch 3.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond
Same as Complaint.
Bail/bond hearing on March 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Arraignment on March 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Case called at 1:37 PM- by Zoom) Defendant James E. Pettis Jr. appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Alicia Linzmeier appeared in court for James E. Pettis Jr., Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Arraignment: 03/31/2022 at 3:30 Branch 3 (to go in with other scheduled cases).

(Case called at 11:03 AM- by Zoom) Defendant James Pettis appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Zebulon Patek. Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. State requests $10,000 cash bond. Defense requests signature bond or significantly lower cash bond. Court orders $10,000 cash bond with various conditions. 
Preliminary Hearing: 03/01/2022 at 1:30 PM.
